object_type_message.content:
We are now going to do bin_packing which is packing all target objects into the box called bin. 
There are many objects in interest such as box, obj1, obj2, obj3 and obj4. 
Divide the type of the objects according to the task.

1. Object: obj1, obj2, obj3, obj4. 
2. Bin: box.

We are now going to do cooking which is cooking foods using given ingredients. In our case, we are only doing slicing. 
When slicing, we only do them on the chopping board. There are many objects in interest such as a plate, carrot, knife, meat, garlic and hopping board. 
Divide the type of the objects according to the task.

1. Location: plate, chopping board. 
2. Ingredients: carrot, meat, garlic. 
3. Tool: knife.

We are now going to do blocksworld which is stacking blocks. 
There are many objects in interest such as a block1, block2, block3, block4 and table. 
Divide the type of the objects according to the task.

1. Blocks: block1, block2, block3, block4. 
2. Base: table.

We are now going to do hanoi which is stacking disks in order from the big ones. 
There are many objects in interest such as blue_disk, red_disk, green_disk, orange_disk, black_disk, wooden_peg1, wooden_peg2 and wooden_peg3. 
Divide the character of the object according to the task. \n

1. Disks: blue_disk, red_disk, green_disk, orange_disk, black_disk. 
2. Pegs: wooden_peg1, wooden_peg2, wooden_peg3.

object_state_message.content:
This is an example of object class code. 

from dataclasses import dataclass


@dataclass
class Object:
    # Basic dataclass
    index: int
    name: str
    location: tuple
    size: tuple
    color: str or bool
    object_type: str


However, here are some predicates to be added such as is_rigid. 
Add such predicates to class Object.

from dataclasses import dataclass


@dataclass
class Object:
    # Basic dataclass
    index: int
    name: str
    location: tuple
    size: tuple
    color: str or bool
    object_type: str

    is_rigid: bool = True

This is a example robot state code. 

from dataclasses import dataclass


@dataclass
class Object:
    # Basic dataclass
    index: int
    name: str
    location: tuple
    size: tuple
    color: str or bool
    object_type: str


However, here are some predicates to add. is_black, is_orange, is_water, and is_foldable. \n

from dataclasses import dataclass


@dataclass
class Object:
    # Basic dataclass
    index: int
    name: str
    location: tuple
    size: tuple
    color: str or bool
    object_type: str

    is_black: bool = True

    is_orange: bool = True

    is_water: bool = True

    is_foldable: bool = True
